storyInfo: Guard arrives at a distillery once occupied by the Victorian Reunion, where he discovers the innocent Sarkaz merchant killed by Victorian Infected. His disintegration starts a fire, and Guard dies trying to save lives.

attributes.text: Sometimes I think that if there really is a Creator responsible for these lands, he's one cruel bastard.
He came up with a really awful disease, where you feel your body being consumed, gradually being replaced by these crystals, helpless to do anything to stop it.
\nYou can feel your very self being removed from your body, day by day.
\nYou can only accept it.
\nWe can only accept it.
And this creation of Oripathy is actually one of the gentler ones across the lands.
\nThe Infected and the uninfected, Nine tells me our persecution is as old as civilization itself.
So... what about poor and rich? Slave and noble?
\nForeigner and local? Disabled and able-bodied? Even abnormal and normal...?
A parasitic disease is scary, sure, but Oripathy is only the most obvious, the most prominent of the terrible diseases out there.
\nThe Creator's really awful inventions are poverty, war, bottomless, insatiable greed, the malice and hypocrisy that bring so much suffering, gaps we can never close.
\nBut the truth is, we all know, no Creator came up with that stuff.
\nHumans, we invented it all on our own.
You and me, we created them.

attributes.content: Good news? Or bad news?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The good news is that the workshop is still intact, the forest hid it good. The dukes and the Sarkaz never got to use it as an outpost.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: The bad news is, someone's living there. We saw lights. I walked up, identified myself, and the lights went out.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Might be refugees or deserters.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But they put out the lights... that means they're wary of us.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Our fighters are ready for anything.
attributes.name: Reunion Warrior

attributes.content: No, let's not be hasty. They might just be cautious, or fearful.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Don't jump to conclusions.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: And anyway, Red's carrying a pretty long blade. Anyone would want to play it safe.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Why don't I go? I'll have a word with them.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: By yourself?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: That's enough. The more men we send, the more nervous they'll be. Besides, if they mean us harm, a few more hands won't make a difference.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The sky to the south has been red for the past few days. Percival and the others even found an Arts Circle...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: We need to move fast.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: There's some risk in that.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But we made it out of Chernobog.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Fair enough.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: We'll be ready to provide support on the sidelines, to make a breakthrough.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: This place was some kind of distillery before the Victorian Reunion settled in?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I can already smell the booze. Romanich would've loved it.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: It certainly was a distillery.
\nSecret distilleries like this are common enough in Victoria, dodging around punishing taxes imposed by the lords. They could be used to make crude medication for the Infected.
\nSoaking, mixing, distilling herbs would work, but purification... no way.
I'm starting to admire the Victorian Reunion. They found this place and turned it into a distribution center for medicine.
\nWhen did they start calling themselves Reunion and build all this? I'm not sure.
\nAll I know is that the building is just an old house covered in vines now.
\nNo movement around, no lights in the house.
A figure flashes by the window. Red was right, there are people here, and they've spotted me.
\nI dust of my clothes and fix my hair, trying to look more presentable.

attributes.content: Hello. Anybody home?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: No answer.

attributes.content: Hi, I'm Guard. I've got a team nearby, I'm pretty sure you saw them earlier?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Don't worry, we mean no harm.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The Victorian Reunion used to use this workshop to make medicine.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: It brought hope to a lot of Infected around Londinium. Its medicine even circulated among the workers in the sewers below the city's industrial districts.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Whoever you are, you know the war is turning a lot more people Infected.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: We want to get things going again here, to help them.
attributes.name: Guard
Guard
attributes.content: Since you're occupying the place...

attributes.name: Guard
attributes.content: We need your cooperation.
We can provide medicine or other supplies. We'll trade fair.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: Still, no response.
The doorknob turns, and I grip the hilt of my sword.
\nAfter everything we've been through, I know it's pretty likely I'll be staring down a pitchfork or hatchet next. I'm numb to that sort of thing now.
The door opens.

attributes.content: Reunion, you said?
attributes.name: Reunion?

attributes.content: Your clothes... who are you?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Mays.
attributes.name: Reunion?

attributes.content: Come in.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: There are more people hiding inside than I guessed. And it's quite a group.
\nSome of them are obviously Infected, while others leaning against the wall are probably ordinary refugees from the city.
\nThey're all looking over, silently, watching me and the woman in the Victorian Reunion uniform.

attributes.content: Look away, and clear out.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: The crowd falls back, and Mays leads me past their collective gaze.
\nThese people... are terrified.

attributes.content: Are you in charge here?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: This place is under my control.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Let's find a place to talk.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: ...Victorian Reunion... Percival is in Victorian Reunion too.
\nOur organization doesn't exactly have franchising procedures and once word of the name spread around, the Reunion flag started popping up in all sorts of places.
\nThat also means there have been various acts of violence, acts of revenge, taking place under the Reunion name.
The kind of thing that happened in Chernobog. I start looking at this... Mays.
\nShe seems nervous, her gait is unnatural.
We're in the deepest depths of the workshop.

attributes.content: Here we are. Nobody comes in here.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: So you're Reunion, the real Reunion. You came from the north?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: From... Ursus?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Yes, Ursus, Columbia, and now we're in Victoria.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: That's a ways.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Your uniform, it's...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I... used a bedsheet.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I ran into a group from Ursus before. They said you dress like this. I think I got the emblem right.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Looks a bit big.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Did you come here just to mock my handiwork?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: So you control this place just because you dressed up in the garb of the infamous 'Reunion'.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Let's get to the point. I don't have much time.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: You want to get this place up and running again? To start making medicine?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Yes, if news got out that Reunion is running the place again...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Things are more complicated than you know. We have all kinds of people here.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I'm worn out breaking up the daily fights between Infected and uninfected. And you want to make Infected medicine? You might as well blow the place up.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: It's hard to keep a balance between them.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: You're Reunion, aren't you? At least, you claim to be.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: More or less.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Who are your people?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: What else would they be? Homeless Infected, war refugees, people who have lost everything. We all need a roof over our heads.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I first came here with a few other Infected. We found this ruin.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Later, more people came, including some... less than honest folk. We don't take anyone else in anymore.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I'm glad to see you, Reunion comrades, but I don't want to worry anyone here.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Worry?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: That you're conspiring with us to wipe out the uninfected in our midst.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Whether or not it's just a pretext to get us to open our doors to you, we can trade supplies. But let's leave it at that...
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: There are plenty of uninfected here, so I get what you're saying.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But I still think it would be a good idea to talk it over with your people before you come to a decision. As long as we can get back to making medicine here, we can come to a long-term agreement—
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: No, no thank you.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Now, off with you. It was nice meeting you.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: If you want to take this place, you're welcome to it. So long as you can take it.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: I can't see her expression behind the mask.
\nMaybe she's just bluffing.

attributes.content: Alright then.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: But I turned around, nevertheless, getting ready to leave.

attributes.content: Hey, Reunion!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Is Talulah with your group?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: ...She is.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: Another Talulah worshiper?
\nSure enough, she's our banner, and that's her cage now too.

attributes.content: I hear she has a nomadic city.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Does that city of hers only take Infected?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: If you haven't been infected, are you allowed to go there?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I've heard... from the passing caravans, I've heard it's a nice place.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: We—There's some people here in less-than-ideal positions, refugees from the wilderness, orphans without a single relative. Talk of that Reunion city has everyone full of hope.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: But... you only stand with the Infected, right?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: A... city?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: There might be a misunderstanding here—
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Mays! Do you know what they did?
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: Did you tell them to do it?! Have you gone mad?!
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: They—Those idiots!
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: He might've been a fighter in the war here! Or some big important figure, here to doom us all!
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: We might be just a couple hours out from a battalion of Sarkaz coming in here to wipe us out!
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: What's going on?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: You... Are you with Reunion, like Mays?
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: It was you, your people—
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: Those Infected, they killed a Sarkaz in the warehouse!
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: Bollocks!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: He... He was Infected too... He's going to explode, right?
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: We need to deal with him!
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: I'll take a look.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Go, quickly! You should be able to help!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: On the ground lies the corpse of a Sarkaz.
\nI... know this guy.
The Sarkaz who rode a motorbike, he was a junkman, going around selling stuff he took off the dead.
\nHe was clearly beaten to death, limbs twisted up in unnatural ways.
\nHis hands are tied. He must've tried to break free, judging by his bloody wrists.
The gathered crowd is mostly silent.
\nI feel a chill, leaving me briefly speechless.

attributes.content: He... he's dead. The Sarkaz aren't so strong.
attributes.name: Indifferent Infected

attributes.content: Here... the medicine he had on him, and some stale bread.
attributes.name: Indifferent Infected

attributes.text: The one who did the killing doesn't look well. He indifferently breaks off a piece of bread and hands it to someone beside him.

attributes.content: He deserved it.
attributes.name: Angry Infected

attributes.text: Someone spits on the ground.
\nOne of them notices me, approaching me while chewing a piece of bread taken off the dead man.

attributes.content: You! You're with Reunion, aren't you?
attributes.name: Angry Infected

attributes.content: Mays never told us how we could join you!
attributes.name: Angry Infected

attributes.text: I remain silent for a while, calming myself down. I lower his hands for him, spotting the Originium crystals growing on his arm.

attributes.content: Why did you do it?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Did he threaten you? Try to hurt you?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Huh? Why?
attributes.name: Angry Infected

attributes.text: It's as if he suddenly loses interest, stumbling over to a nearby crate and taking a seat.

attributes.content: When the Sarkaz burned our farm and humiliated my daughter, did anyone ask why?
attributes.name: Angry Infected

attributes.content: He wasn't a soldier. He wasn't a murderous devil from Kazdel. He was just a wandering hawker, selling his wares on the battlefields.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: He... even helped you.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Huh, what does he mean? Was he Reunion too?
attributes.name: Indifferent Infected

attributes.content: I am Reunion.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: You lot must know what it is Reunion fights for.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Sure, you're fighting for all the Infected!
attributes.name: Indifferent Infected

attributes.content: This man that you tortured to death, the one who never even got a chance to share his name...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Wasn't he an Infected?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But he was Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Angry Infected

attributes.text: 'Medicine and compassion cannot help the Infected in a way that matters, but solidary and strength can.'
Solidarity... solidarity.
\nInfected have no homeland. We share the same fate, the same sorrow.
\nThese people don't understand... they've never thought about it.
\nBut, what about us?
Will the veterans from Ursus on the team treat the Infected from Kazimierz well? Can Sankta Infected coexist with Sarkaz?
\nEven at Rhodes Island, I...
What about the future? If we succeed one day, and the Emperor of Ursus vows to stop massacring the Infected, if he agrees to grant us land and cities...
\nIn this beautiful, seemingly impossible future...
Will Reunion, will the Infected, start killing each other?
\nWill we fracture, collapse, and give them another chance to butcher us?

attributes.content: Hey, Guard, his corpse... it's glowing, he's about to disintegrate!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: I had no idea his condition was so serious.
\nOr did he really not leave any medicine for himself, trying to save money for some future that would not be his own?

attributes.content: Get out of here! Now!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Run! Run!
attributes.name: Indifferent Infected

attributes.content: Mays! How do you process the Infected here?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: That room, the innermost one!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Hurry, we have to throw him in there!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Damn it, damn it all... I need a second, protection... for the nose, mouth, and wounds...
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: Mays and I lift the Sarkaz's corpse and kick open the door.
Upon opening it, my personal Originium monitor started beeping incessantly. I've never heard the alarm going so intensely before.
\nJust...
\nJust how many Infected were processed here?
Every inch of the room is covered with a thick layer of Originium dust, crystal clusters forming in the corners.
\n'Danger' is no longer sufficient to describe the urgency of the situation.
\nI don't know when things are going to get out of hand for this place, but... putting a disintegrating Infected in there is definitely not a good idea.

attributes.content: No good, move, move!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: What are you doing?! Why is the body—
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: There's too much Originium in here. How many Infected have been processed in this room?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I... Well... it was years they were being processed in there!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: There's Originium dust in the air, the place won't survive a violent disintegration!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Get everyone out, now!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Wh-What?
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: Don't you get it? The Originium environment here is extremely unstable. The place could blow at any minute!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: So we leave? And go where?
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: Everything out there is—
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: There's no time!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: We're talking about Reunion here! They have an entire bloody nomadic city!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Run, get them all moving!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I've contacted some of our teams on the outskirts, they'll take some of you in!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Ugh, there's still some booze left in the distillery. If there's an explosion, the whole place is going with it!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: And that—
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Hey, Mays, where are you going?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: The woman dressed in a Reunion uniform is struggling with the machinery in the deepest depths of the workshop.

attributes.content: What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I'm... Hngh... Help me pull that lever...
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Did you work here before? But you're not Infected!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Thanks for not exposing me! Hngh... pull harder!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Where did you get that Reunion outfit?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: This used to be a Reunion base, and so many died here... Don't test my patience!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I... I didn't do anything!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: That's what they all say.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I was... a worker here. That Reunion lot took over the distillery, and they needed hands to run the machines for them.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I... it's just, the mercenaries hired by the lord attacked, and I ran... I'm not Infected, why should I die here with those Reunion?!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: So why did you come back?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Because I had nowhere else to go, dammit! What other reason would I end up trading my life for a secret distillery?!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I'm not Infected, but sometimes I feel like I'd rather be with Reunion! At least they have something to fight against, they have a purpose!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: Pull harder! It's stuck!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: First, open the switch for this unloading port. Reunion left behind a whole lot of material!
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: The doctor said this was the cheapest painkiller formula, they were working on it for a long time. It only relieves pain, but that's enough, right?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: With this... can I be a genuine part of Reunion?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: That is... I might be allowed a home in your nomadic city?
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: A nomadic city...
I take a deep breath and throw out a kick. It makes me sore.
The lever finally loosens.
\nThe machine comes to life. The giant hopper tilts to one side and what falls out of it is countless... petals.
\nShe hurriedly picks up the herbs scattered across the ground and carefully piles them in her arms.
If I don't consider where exactly I am, I feel like this could be... a beautiful sight.
\nJust like that city.

attributes.content: We don't have a city.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But, those Reunion guys all said—
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: But, you... but...
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: ...Ahah... well...
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: I mean... a nomadic city... a city, you know, we...
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: People without a home, people with nowhere to go, the Infected across the world are growing more and more numerous.
\nIt's not that the disease is becoming more virulent, it's just that the world is becoming more cruel.
The great worthies have so much to say about the 'modern' era we live in, an unprecedented era of high-speed battleships, nomadic cities, of industry—
\nHow enlightened our era is—
\nHow tragic our era is.
'Stand together.'
\nCan the Infected really stand together, naturally?
\nWho do we stand with? Is it just the Infected?
\nThat... nomadic city we're dreaming of, does it have a place for them?
\nIs a city enough to accommodate everything?

attributes.content: Take the herbs, we need to leave.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: There is no application to join Reunion. If you're willing to fight side-by-side with us, you're already Reunion.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But... I'm not Infected.
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.content: It's not only the Infected who want to resist.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: And besides, I need you to help me figure out who killed that Sarkaz man.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: They need to be punished.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Now come on, let's go!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: We make our way quickly through the gigantic tanks, some places have already started collapsing. The air is full of the pungent scent of alcohol, with smoke floating in from somewhere.
\nThis workshop, where the Victorian Reunion began, is about to go up in flames.

attributes.content: We're almost there, quickly now.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: The waves of intense heat hit, Mays struggles to stay standing, the herbs in her arms are lifted by the hot air.

attributes.content: Agh! My—
attributes.name: Mays

attributes.text: Above our heads roars the sound of buckling metal.
Well, alright, I push her away.
\nThen, I jump up with all my strength, and gather up the petals.
A collapse.
\nIt's hot.
\nThe sun is burning. I'm burning.
Is that the exit?
\nA few steps further.
But they're watching behind me. Those eyes... are they judging me? Or just judging my insignificant death?
\nWhat did they expect of me?
I can't think about it... I can't.
\nMaybe I let them down with their deaths. They should hope for a more meaningful end for me.
\nLike, I don't know, dying on the steps of the palace in Deity Grypherburg? Anyway, not here, not dying for an uninfected woman I just met, holding some broken petals in my arms.
How could I face them here?
\nBut I still need to face them.

attributes.content: Take them... and go.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The exit is right ahead, don't lose them this time, I might've... crushed some of the petals, give them to a woman named Nine, she knows what to do.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Don't dawdle, move.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: It's hot. It burns.
\nI remember the afternoon when I first learned I had Oripathy.
\nWhat was it exactly that caused my infection? I still don't actually know.
Maybe it was the time I fell in the river and something scratched my leg. Might've been an active Originium crystal instead of a rock.
\nMaybe it was the dust I inhaled in the mines.
\nMaybe it was industrial waste from the factories. Maybe.
But when I got home, the smell of smoke in the room hadn't dissipated. My luggage was packed and placed on the table where we usually ate together.
\nI found a salt lake, but I wasn't lucky. Maybe I chose the wrong place, there was no boat at the time.
\nI owe a lot to the Rhodes Island operator who came over and talked to me when I was sitting by the lake.

attributes.content: Nine, Red, Percival, Talulah, guh...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'm not sure if I'll be burned to cinders by the time you find me, but I hope this recorder survives.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: You ask—
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Are we fighting for all the 'Infected'?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Whether they're despicable, upper class, or even... royalty?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Or... are the people we unite with, the people we want to fight alongside—
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Only the Infected?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Only... them?
attributes.name: Guard
